definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
water-boarding, interrogation technique used by CIA

sentences.english: The water torture was a favorite among Japanese POW guards during WWII.
sentences.chinese: 水刑是二战时期日本战俘守卫最喜欢的一种刑罚。

sentences.english: He points out that his lawyers told him that waterboarding was not torture.
sentences.chinese: 他同时指出，律师们告诉他施以水刑算不上是虐囚。

sentences.english: Cheney was unapologetic about the harsh interrogation methods that he had approved, such as waterboarding.
sentences.chinese: 切尼对自己支持的诸如水刑的严刑逼供并未有悔意。

sentences.english: The televised glimpses of waterboarding will provoke gasps among the audience.
sentences.chinese: 电视转播水刑的镜头会让观众倒抽一口气。

definition: execution by fire/burning at the stake

tiger bench (torture method in which the victim sits with legs extended horizontally along a bench, upper legs held down with straps while bricks are inserted under the feet, forcing the knee joint to bend in reverse)
to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
a death claimed to be a suicide by the authorities
corporal punishment (such as castration or amputation)
